content: I've noticed that we use two different scroll bars in the UI: one that is customized, much fancier, for the streams list; and the browser's default one for the presence list. Is this intended?
The one for the streams list is a lot harder for me to use because it's so much slimmer. I have a harder time selecting it.
I should mention this in the warts topic!

But that custom scroll looks much better than the browser's default. Like it gives a modern UI look. I guess we should have it everywhere. Of course we can have improve upon the scroll being slim. Like hovering over scroll makes it widen up bit.
yeah, definitely. I don't think it'd even be very hard to roll out -- we're just using a library for it...

And there's lots of places we want it:

  • emoji reactions popover
  • presence list
  • settings/administration pages
Continuing with what @Sumana Harihareswara mentioned about them being too narrow, I was thinking that we could make the clicking area wider than what the actual scroll bar you can see.

@Durga Akhil Mundroy said:

@Sumana Harihareswara Tim mentioned that we use jquery-perfect-scrollbar. I was looking at this and the scrollbar widens on hover. Would this help the streams scrollbar?

I like this.
I guess wouldn't that become a little bit of less intuitive as person will try to go over the scroll to do the action.
@Aditya Bansal I'm not quite sure what you mean -- it worked well for me when I tried it.
Yes that is exactly i was trying to suggest here @Sumana Harihareswara . Like scroll widen when hovered.
This looks like a pretty good idea. Maybe we would need to move the chevrons a bit to the left, but that should be easy.

@Aditya Bansal I'm not quite sure what you mean -- it worked well for me when I tried it.

Actually the reply was meant for Yago's message just above your's. Guess i should have quoted it. Sorry.
I guess i just discovered a bug. Quoted messages should not have highlight like my last message.

By the way, now that I'm creating issues, should I create a couple of them for these?

  • Make the scrollbar wider on hover.
  • Using the same scrollbar style everywhere in the UI.
Sure, though the wider-on-hover we might get by just upgrading
